segments.source_content:
---
slug: /170
title: "This Week In React #170: Waku, Remix, Donuts, RSC resentment, React 19, Aria Components, Storybook, Postgres Components, hydration, streams, VisionOS, atob, Maestro, Orbit, Tamagui, VisionCamera..."
authors: [slorber, bndkt]
date: 01-17-2024
---
Hi everyone!

This week we had some really great React articles, but also interesting releases from Waku and Remix. The community shared mitigated but interesting feedback on React Server Components, regarding complexity and ownership.

translations.fr: Cette semaine, nous avons eu de trÃ¨s bons articles sur React, mais aussi des versions intÃ©ressantes de Waku et Remix. La communautÃ© a partagÃ© des retours mitigÃ©s mais intÃ©ressants sur les React Server Components, concernant la complexitÃ© et la propriÃ©tÃ©.

segments.source_content: On the React Native side, it's calm. We are eagerly waiting for the Expo SDK 50 which this time is released much later than the beta. We are also waiting for the official launch of VisionOS, a new platform that React Native will support.

translations.fr: CÃ´tÃ© React Native, c'est calme. Nous attendons impatiemment l'Expo SDK 50 qui cette fois est publiÃ© bien plus tard que la bÃªta. Nous attendons Ã©galement le lancement officiel de VisionOS, une nouvelle plateforme que React Native prendra en charge.

segments.source_content: I just [celebrated 10 years of React experience](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1747307299356447148) ğŸ™‰ It's hard to believe how my career changed thanks to React, considering I used to really dislike JavaScript.

segments.source_content: ## âš›ï¸ React {#react}
[![Waku 0.19](/emails/issues/170/waku.jpg)](https://waku.gg/blog/introducing-create-pages)
**[Waku 0.19](https://waku.gg/blog/introducing-create-pages)**

This release introduces a new `createPage` API for creating layouts and pages programmatically. This notably marks the shift of Waku from being a React Server Components learning experience to becoming a real production-ready React framework. A lightweight file-based page route is expected for v0.20.

translations.fr: Cette version introduit une nouvelle API `createPage` pour crÃ©er des mises en page et des pages de maniÃ¨re programmatique. Cela marque notamment le passage de Waku d'une expÃ©rience d'apprentissage des React Server Components Ã  un vÃ©ritable framework React prÃªt pour la production. Un routage de page basÃ© sur des fichiers lÃ©ger est prÃ©vu pour la v0.20.
translations.en: Cette version introduit une nouvelle API `createPage` pour crÃ©er des layouts et des pages programmatiquement. Cela marque le passage de Waku d'une expÃ©rience d'apprentissage de React Server Components Ã  un vÃ©ritable framework React prÃªt pour la production. Un routage de pages basÃ© sur les fichiers est prÃ©vu pour la v0.20.

segments.source_content: [![Delicious Donut Components](/emails/issues/170/donuts.jpg)](https://frontendatscale.com/blog/donut-components/)
**[Delicious Donut Components](https://frontendatscale.com/blog/donut-components/)**

This joyful and awesome interactive article uses the donut analogy (client component with a â€œchildrenâ€ hole) to explain how client/server components can be interleaved. It also covers more advanced RSC composition topics. Today I learned about that fancy server action render prop trick!

translations.fr: Cet article interactif joyeux et gÃ©nial utilise l'analogie du donut (composant client avec un trou Â« children Â») pour expliquer comment les composants client/serveur peuvent Ãªtre entrelacÃ©s. Il aborde Ã©galement des sujets de composition RSC plus avancÃ©s. Aujourd'hui, j'ai appris cette astuce Ã©lÃ©gante de render prop avec les actions serveur !
translations.en: Cet article interactif joyeux et gÃ©nial utilise l'analogie du donut (composant client avec un trou "children") pour expliquer comment les composants client/serveur peuvent s'entrelacer. Il couvre Ã©galement des sujets plus avancÃ©s de composition RSC. Aujourd'hui, j'ai dÃ©couvert cette astuce Ã©lÃ©gante de render prop pour les actions serveur !

- ğŸ’¸ [Take the Developer Nation Survey - For each completed response, Developer Nation will donate to one of the charities of respondentsâ€™ choosing!](https://developereconomics.net/?member_id=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=nl_ad4)
- ğŸ¦ [Dan Abramov - â€œReact Server Components does not require a serverâ€](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov2/status/1745795274977493317): Another important reminder that RSCs can all run at build time too, and the CI is your server. You can deploy a completely static Next.js site using RSCs to S3 or GitHub Pages.
- ğŸ¦ [React v19 is coming - React v18.3 is not planned](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1747633798374625525)
- ğŸ¦ [Pre-rendering (SSG) is coming to Remix](https://twitter.com/brophdawg11/status/1747402216925704684)
- ğŸ‘€ [React Postgres Components](https://react-postgres-components.vercel.app/): Render React SSR using V8 inside Postgres RPC? Sounds crazy, but works!
- ğŸ“œ [React Libraries for 2024](https://www.robinwieruch.de/react-libraries/): As every year, Robin Wieruch updated his list of recommended React libraries, a good way to discover many libs of the ecosystem.
- ğŸ“œ [Kind of annoyed at React](https://blog.cassidoo.co/post/annoyed-at-react/): Cassidy shares a reasonable take on the current state of React that seems to resonate with the community, notably ğŸ¦ [Tanner Linsley using React with increasing resentment](https://twitter.com/tannerlinsley/status/1746970043836158330).
- ğŸ“œ [React, where are you going?](https://dev.to/matfrana/react-where-are-you-going-5284): Matteo builds on top of Cassidyâ€™s take and explains his frustration regarding React ownership and increasing complexity. He advocates for a financially sustainable community-driven framework. What struck me is that adding RSC support to their lib React-Bricks decreased the DX (also confirmed by a few others, ğŸ¦ [tweet](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1747643069460021405)).
- ğŸ“œ [Streams and React Server Components](https://minimalistweb.dev/p/streams-and-react-server-components): Even apart from RSC, this is a great deep dive into the Streams APIs from a Waku contributor.
- ğŸ“œ [Server-side rendering local dates without FOUC](https://blog.6nok.org/server-side-rendering-local-dates-without-fouc/): Itâ€™s common to get React hydration mismatches when trying to render time in the user timezone. This suggests to inline a script to modify the DOM SSR-rendered time just before React hydrates to avoid the mismatch.
- ğŸ“œ [How to setup Client-Server Relaying in Next.js](https://ericbureltech.hashnode.dev/how-to-setup-client-server-relaying-in-nextjs): Explains how we can render a dynamic value on the server, and then let SWR take over that value on the client.
- ğŸ“œ [Say Hello to Panda CSS - The New CSS-in-JS Library with Zero Runtime](https://www.telerik.com/blogs/say-hello-panda-css-new-css-js-library-zero-runtime)
- ğŸ“œ [Build Dynamic Forms with React Hook Form](https://claritydev.net/blog/build-dynamic-forms-react-hook-form)
- ğŸ“¦ [Remix 2.5 - SPA mode](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#v250): Deploy Remix apps without a server (e.g. on GitHub pages) using SPA mode, generating a single `index.html` file.
- ğŸ“¦ [React-Aria-Components + Tailwind starter kit - New set of beautifully styled component that you can modify](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/react-aria/getting-started.html#starter-kits)
- ğŸ¥ [A Beginnerâ€™s Guide to Storybook 7 with React - free Egghead course](https://egghead.io/courses/a-beginner-s-guide-to-storybook-7-with-react-56f61ecf)
- ğŸ” [Critical security vulnerability in @clerk/nextjs - upgrade to 4.29.3](https://clerk.com/changelog/2024-01-12)

segments.source_content: Transform your applications with Apryse's React PDF Library. Seamlessly integrate an exceptional viewer experience for web, mobile, and desktop. View, edit, redact and annotate with support for PDFs, Microsoft Office, video, images, HTML, and more.
